meanings.sent1: The shahs ruled over the land with wisdom and strength.
meanings.sent2: In history books, you can read about the powerful shahs of ancient Persia.
meanings.sent3: The group of shahs gathered for a royal feast, but they all wore silly hats.
meanings.sent4: The shahs stood tall like mighty oak trees in the forest of rulers.
meanings.sent5: The golden crowns of the shahs gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of their authority.

meanings.definition: Shahs: a title of the former monarch of Iran
meanings.sent1: My grandfather told me stories about the wise shahs of Iran.
meanings.sent2: The shahs of Iran lived in grand palaces filled with treasures.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought it was a shahs and demanded to be fed caviar.
meanings.sent4: The shahs of Iran were like stars in the night sky, guiding their people.
meanings.sent5: The portraits of the shahs hung proudly in the halls of history, watching over the nation.

meanings.definition: Shahs: a unit of currency in Iran
meanings.sent1: The market bustled with traders exchanging goods for shahs.
meanings.sent2: With a handful of shahs, you could buy many delicious fruits at the market.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to bury the shiny shahs in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter tinkled like a bag of shahs falling on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The shahs jingled in his pocket, a reminder of his hard work and savings.
